snippet: The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act was stopped by the objections of Senator Tom Coburn, who says the bill transfers risk to the federal government but leaves profits in the hands of insurers.
abstract: Terrorism Risk Assurance Act, which required insurers to provide federally guaranteed financial protection from terrorist attacks, will lapse on Jan 1, 2015; analysts fear major market disruption, even if effects are not instantaneous.
lead_paragraph: The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act was stopped by the objections of Senator Tom Coburn, who says the bill transfers risk to the federal government but leaves profits in the hands of insurers.

headline.main: Congressional Roadblock Upends Market for Terrorism Insurance
headline.print_headline: One Senator’s Objection Doomed Guaranteed Terrorism Insurance Bill
